com.github.katjahahn.parser.sections

Class SectionLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.katjahahn.parser.sections.SectionLoader

  • public class SectionLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    Responsible for computing section related values and loading sections with the given section header information.

    The section loader is able to load special sections like the ImportSection, ExportSection and ResourceSection

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SectionLoader.BytesAndOffset
      Data structure to return or pass a bytes and offset pair.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SectionLoader(PEData data)
      Creates a SectionLoader instance taking all information from the given PEData object.
      SectionLoader(SectionTable table, OptionalHeader optHeader, COFFFileHeader coffHeader, java.io.File file)
      Creates a SectionLoader instance with a file and the corresponding section table and optional Header of that file.

    • Method Detail

      • maybeLoadSection

        @Ensures(value="result != null")
public com.google.common.base.Optional<PESection> maybeLoadSection(java.lang.String name)
                                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Loads the first section with the given name. If the file doesn't have a section by this name, it returns absent.

        This does not instantiate special sections. Use methods like loadImportSection() or loadResourceSection() instead.

        The file on disk is read to fetch the information

        Parameters:
        name - the section's name
        Returns:
        PESection of the given name, absent if section isn't contained in file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to read the file

      • loadSection

        @Ensures(value="result != null")
public PESection loadSection(int sectionNr)
        Loads the section with the sectionNr.

        This does not instantiate special sections. Use methods like loadImportSection() or loadResourceSection() instead.

        Parameters:
        sectionNr - the section's number
        Returns:
        PESection of the given number
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if invalid sectionNr

      • loadSectionFrom

        @Ensures(value="result != null")
public PESection loadSectionFrom(SectionHeader header)
        Loads the section that belongs to the header.

        This does not instantiate special sections. Use methods like loadImportSection() or loadResourceSection() instead.

        Parameters:
        header - the section's header
        Returns:
        PESection that belongs to the header

      • loadSectionBytes

        @Ensures(value="result != null")
public SectionLoader.BytesAndOffset loadSectionBytes(int sectionNr)
                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Returns the bytes of the section with the specified number.
        Parameters:
        sectionNr - the number of the section
        Returns:
        bytes that represent the section with the given section number
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if section too large to fit into a byte array

      • loadSectionBytesFor

        @Requires(value="header != null")
@Ensures(value="result != null")
public SectionLoader.BytesAndOffset loadSectionBytesFor(SectionHeader header)
                                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Loads the bytes of the section and returns bytes and file offset.
        Parameters:
        header - of the section
        Returns:
        bytes and file offset of the section
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if file can not be read
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if section too large to fit into a byte array

      • getReadSize

        @Ensures(value="result >= 0")
public long getReadSize(SectionHeader header)
        Determines the the number of bytes that is read for the section.
        Parameters:
        header - header of the section
        Returns:
        section size

      • loadDebugSection

        @Ensures(value="result != null")
public DebugSection loadDebugSection()
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Loads all bytes and information of the debug section. The file on disk is read to fetch the information.
        Returns:
        DebugSection of the given file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if unable to read the file
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if unable to load debug section

      • maybeGetFileOffsetFor

        @Ensures(value="result != null")
public com.google.common.base.Optional<java.lang.Long> maybeGetFileOffsetFor(DataDirectoryKey dataDirKey)
        Returns the file offset of the data directory entry the given key belongs to.
        Parameters:
        dataDirKey - the key of the data directory entry
        Returns:
        file offset of the rva that is in the data directory entry with the given key, absent if file offset can not be determined

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        file offset optional, absent if it can not be determined.
